content: Morning Rohan - welcome aboard. Excited to start this journey with you. Think of us as your health strategy team. We'll keep your 3 goals front and centre: heart health, cognitive performance, proactive screening.
Morning Neel, sounds greatüëç I'm on board as long as we keep things efficient and data-backed.
Exactly. We'll run this like a performance project ‚Äî measurable inputs, clear outputs. Ruby will take over day-to-day coordination so you don't have to chase anything.
Hi Rohan! I'm Ruby - I'll be your main point for everything. Could you share Sarah's contact? I'll loop her in so we handle all scheduling/logistics directly.
Hi Ruby, great to meet you. Sarah's number is +65 XXXX XXXX, email sarah.tan@***. Please coordinate directly with her.
Got it - thanks Rohan. I'll send Sarah the onboarding list today so you can focus on work.
Rohan, quick note on the baseline blood panel - we're including ApoB and Lp(a). These are strong predictors of heart disease risk, particularly relevant given your family history.
Makes sense, I've read ApoB is more predictive than LDL. Good to know we're covering it.
Exactly. LDL tells part of the story, but ApoB measures the actual particle count. Lower particles = lower risk.
Lab appointment booked for Wed 9:00 AM at Raffles Medical, Raffles Place. Sarah has the details.
Perfect. I'll be there.
Morning Rohan - your Garmin is great for workouts, but I recommend adding an Oura ring. It'll capture HRV and sleep data with high resolution. Useful before lab results come in.
I've heard mixed reviews on Oura's accuracy. Worth it?
For trends, yes. It's not perfect minute-to-minute, but very solid for nightly HRV, sleep staging, and recovery readiness.
I can order the Oura today for delivery this week. Black, silver, or stealth?
Stealth, size 11. Thanks.
Done‚úÖ Delivery Friday.
Hi Rohan ‚Äî I've emailed your cook a simple photo-log protocol for all your meals this week. No need for you to track manually.
Appreciated. This really takes the load off.
Labs done‚úÖ Results will be in by Friday. Dr Warren will review first.
Quick question - what's your take on biological age tests? Are they legit?
They vary. DNA methylation tests are most validated. Others, like blood-marker algorithms, can be useful for trend tracking but shouldn't be taken as absolute.
Got it. So more directional than definitive.
Exactly.
Morning Rohan, Sarah confirmed your VO‚ÇÇ Max test for Monday at 8 AM, Singapore Sports Institute.
Noted. I'll block my morning.
Hi Rohan, post-labs I'll send you a 2-week mobility + light cardio plan. We'll adjust intensity based on VO‚ÇÇ and HRV.
Sounds good Rachel.
Oura ring delivered. Sarah will bring it to your office today.
Thanks Ruby.
Lab results in. Dr Warren's reviewing tonight, will update tomorrow.
Overall profile's decent. ApoB is a bit elevated; Lp(a) in normal range. We'll fine-tune diet and possibly add a supplement.
Ok, let's aim to to that without impacting focus or energy.
We can start with soluble fiber increase and tweak your fat sources. Minimal disruption to meals.
Easy enough. Thanks Carla.
Your week's been a win: labs done, wearable added, food logging started. Monday's VO‚ÇÇ Max will complete your baseline.
Good start indeed. Appreciate the smooth handling
Travel next week, right? I'll prep the portable kit and adjust your plan for hotel workouts.
Yes ‚Äî Seoul Wed to Sat. Hotel gym's decent.
Got it. I'll send your Seoul-specific plan to Sarah by tonight. I'll also schedule your DEXA scan for Sunday with Sarah.
